tit.e: Nyoin (a close female relative of the Emperor or a womwan of comparable standing)

sen.e: Nyoin indicates a title, such as the three empresses (grand empress dowager, empress dowager, empress) or an equivalent status (jugo, princess, etc.), bestowed upon a woman, and is a system that continued from the middle of the Heian period until the Meiji Restoration.

Nyoin indicates a title, such as the three empresses (grand empress dowager, empress dowager, empress) or an equivalent status (jugo, princess, etc.), bestowed upon a woman, and is a system that continued from the middle of the Heian period until the Meiji Restoration.

Nyoin indicates a title bestowed upon a woman, such as the three empresses (grand empress dowager, empress dowager, empress) or an equivalent status (jugo, honorary rank next to the three Empresses and princess, etc.) and is a system that continued from the middle of the Heian period until the Meiji Restoration.
